OM_Astarion_COM.synopsis: Gandrel is a monster hunter we encounter outside the Hag's lair. He's pleasant, cheerful, and a little eccentric - but shows his experience and expertise when warning us about the hag. He's affable and unassuming, but shows moments of steel when discussing his quarry (Astarion, although he doesn't realise his quarry is standing in front of him.) At first Astarion thinks its funny to meet a monster hunter (as he's a monster) but turns sour when he discovers that he's the target.
OM_Astarion_COM.how_to_trigger: repro steps:1. Start the game and proceed to the TUT level.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. Using the debug book add Asterion as a companion.4. goto -26.208; 7.907; 238.965. Succeed the perception check (Shift-Q) or not6. Talk with Gandrel.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM.synopsis: Astarion meets a Gur Hunter that reveals he's hunting a vampire spawn - Astarion himself, although the hunter doesn't realise this. Astarion starts with a mocking tone, but once he realises the hunter's purpose he tries to get some information before leaving or killing the hunter.
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game as Astarion2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. SetGlobalOsirisFlag ORI_Astarion_Knows_Vampireness4. goto -22.73, 7.68, 241.08. The swamp illusion check will trigger.5. Speak to Gandrel.

OM_Astarion_COM_52.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_52.text: What'll you do when you find him? Kill the vampire?

OM_Astarion_COM_22.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_22.text: I'm here to help. This is Astarion - the vampire you're hunting.

OM_Astarion_COM_53.speaker: Narrator
OM_Astarion_COM_53.text: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*

OM_Astarion_COM_89.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_89.text: Powdered iron-vine. An old hunter's trick - most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.

OM_Astarion_COM_28.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_28.text: You're a monster hunter? I'm surprised - I thought all Gur were vagrant cut-throats.

OM_Astarion_COM_152.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_152.text: And more! We steal chickens, curse your crops, seduce your daughters - the list goes on.

OM_Astarion_COM_100.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_100.text: Pardon, but who - or what - is a Gur?

OM_Astarion_COM_130.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_130.text: A mystical and dangerous people, we travel the land, never settling in one place.

OM_Astarion_COM_115.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_115.text: We steal your chickens, curse your crops, seduce your daughters - your friend here has heard it all, I'm sure.

OM_Astarion_COM_71.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_71.text: I wish I had half the power settled folk think my people possess. Alas, I am a simple wanderer.

OM_Astarion_COM_92.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_92.text: A simple wanderer and monster hunter. But I'm no witchdoctor or cut-throat.
OM_Astarion_COM_92.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

OM_Astarion_COM_108.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_108.text: I assume you want to kill the hag?

OM_Astarion_COM_123.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_123.text: Or to make a deal with her. Probably think you can outfox the old dear.

OM_Astarion_COM_99.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_99.text: Right, but very wrong. My prey is a vampire spawn - much less impressive than the beast that lives here.

OM_Astarion_COM_48.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_48.text: I fear he's gone to ground. I hope the hag of these lands can help me flush him out, if I can afford her blood price.
OM_Astarion_COM_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on Astarion here, he should visually react to the news that he's being hunted.NodeContext: The hag's 'blood price' is likely to be something that'll cost him dearly.

OM_Astarion_COM_73.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_73.text: It is a sacred mission from the head of my tribe. She sent me here to capture the beast and return it to her.

OM_Astarion_COM_50.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_50.text: Baldur's Gate. My people wait for me there.

OM_Astarion_COM_161.speaker: Narrator
OM_Astarion_COM_161.text: *Under all the smiles, you can feel Astarion's tension. He's coiled like a spring, hand inching towards his weapon.*

OM_Astarion_COM_63.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_63.text: Cough and give Astarion a warning look.

OM_Astarion_COM_113.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_113.text: Is your friend ill? I have some tea that might help...
OM_Astarion_COM_113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion is staring at the Gur Hunter

OM_Astarion_COM_141.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_141.context: NodeContext: Coming back to yourself. You've been thinking about killing this guy, but the player has subtly warned you not to.

OM_Astarion_COM_21.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_21.text: How do you capture a vampire, exactly?

OM_Astarion_COM_56.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_56.text: Beyond that, I will say no more. There are some trade secrets we cannot share.

OM_Astarion_COM_36.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_36.text: We should go, but you have fun tracking your monster.
OM_Astarion_COM_36.context: NodeContext: 'We' referring to Astarion and the player. 'Monster' said with faint distain. You're talking about yourself.

OM_Astarion_COM_34.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_34.text: Why not join us? We could use a monster hunter.

OM_Astarion_COM_76.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_76.text: No! I mean - we have different quests. I wouldn't want to distract this fellow from his path any more than he'd want to lead us from ours.

OM_Astarion_COM_154.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_154.text: The elf is right. I have my own road to walk.

OM_Astarion_COM_145.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_145.text: A more difficult road, now that the hag is gone, but perhaps a better one.

OM_Astarion_COM_158.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_158.text: But I wish you well. Be safe.

OM_Astarion_COM_0.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_0.text: A road that leads me straight to a hag's den, alas. But I wish you well. Be safe.

OM_Astarion_COM_165.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_165.text: Thank you. Treating with a hag, I need all the luck I can get.

OM_Astarion_COM_30.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_30.text: [To Astarion] You're asking a lot of questions.

OM_Astarion_COM_135.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_135.text: I've crossed paths with your people before, you know.

OM_Astarion_COM_20.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion pulls the dagger loose and lets the corpse fall to the floor.NodeContext: You've just stabbed your nemesis in the eye with a dagger. You pull it loose as he slumps to the floor. This line follows on from 'I've crossed paths with his people before' -> (stabbing) -> it wasn't a good experience.

OM_Astarion_COM_55.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_55.text: What the hells? He could have helped us!

OM_Astarion_COM_86.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_86.text: The Gur help themselves, no one else. Whatever his price, it would've been too much.

OM_Astarion_COM_90.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_90.text: Trust me, I did us a favour.

OM_Astarion_COM_33.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_33.text: It's a figure of speech, darling. I'd be disappointed if you trusted me at all.

OM_Astarion_COM_84.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_84.text: You killed him because you're bigoted against his people?

OM_Astarion_COM_41.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_41.context: NodeContext: Just been called bigoted. About to say "if you'd seen what they did to me", but thinks better of it

OM_Astarion_COM_104.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_104.text: No. No, we're done here. Let's go.

OM_Astarion_COM_39.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_39.text: What favour, exactly? He didn't need to die.

OM_Astarion_COM_7.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_7.text: I had my reasons, you can be sure of that.

OM_Astarion_COM_102.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_102.text: Now, if we're done, we have more important business to get on with.

OM_Astarion_COM_15.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_15.text: Next time, warn me before you murder someone.

OM_Astarion_COM_17.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_17.text: I absolutely, definitely will think about it.

OM_Astarion_COM_43.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_43.text: ...Tell me you had a good reason for that.

OM_Astarion_COM_12.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_12.text: He was spinning a tale, and you were falling for it. Vampires? Sacred missions? Honestly.

OM_Astarion_COM_139.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_139.text: He would've followed us to camp and slit our throats in the night.

OM_Astarion_COM_162.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_162.text: Let's go, we've wasted enough time talking.

OM_Astarion_COM_124.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_124.text: You're asking why a monster hunter would hunt a monster?

OM_Astarion_COM_62.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_62.text: Just so. Vampires are godless parasites - we do not need a reason to destroy them.

OM_Astarion_COM_96.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_96.text: But in this case, it is a sacred mission from the head of my tribe. She sent me here to capture the beast and return it to her.

OM_Astarion_COM_134.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_134.text: Yes, yes, fine. It's just - specific. Why not kill the gnolls or goblins rampaging around here?

OM_Astarion_COM_140.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_140.text: I fear he's gone to ground. I hoped the hag of these lands could help me flush him out, but it seems she is no more.
OM_Astarion_COM_140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Focus on Astarion here, he should visually react to the news that he's being hunted.

OM_Astarion_COM_38.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_38.text: His name is Astarion, but I fear he's gone to ground. I hope the hag of these lands can help me flush him out, if I can afford her blood price.
OM_Astarion_COM_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion and the player exchange a lookNodeContext: The hag's 'blood price' is likely to be something that'll cost him dearly.

OM_Astarion_COM_40.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_40.text: And when you find this 'Astarion'? You'll kill him?

OM_Astarion_COM_117.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_117.text: Not this time. My orders are to capture him.

OM_Astarion_COM_119.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_119.text: Oh? And bring him where, exactly?

OM_Astarion_COM_103.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_103.text: Only a spawn? Pity. Not like it's a real vampire.

OM_Astarion_COM_155.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_155.text: I don't know. I'm sure a vampire spawn could still rip your throat out if he felt like it.

OM_Astarion_COM_101.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_101.text: He is right, unfortunately. They are only weak when compared to their masters.

OM_Astarion_COM_121.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_121.text: During the day, we have the advantage. But at night, when they hunt? You will not find a more deadly quarry.

OM_Astarion_COM_133.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_133.text: Yes, I'm sure they can creep right up on you.

OM_Astarion_COM_107.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_107.text: We've all survived so far. Let's focus on that.

OM_Astarion_COM_129.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_129.text: It would still be wise to post guards at night. The threat is real.

OM_Astarion_COM_128.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_128.text: Indeed it is. We should do something about this threat.
OM_Astarion_COM_128.context: NodeContext: To player, referring to the threat the hunter poses, without alerting the hunter.

OM_Astarion_COM_144.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_144.text: All right, kill him if you must.

OM_Astarion_COM_131.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_131.text: We'll be careful, but we should get going.

OM_Astarion_COM_11.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_11.text: Interesting. Astarion, what do you think?

OM_Astarion_COM_69.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_69.context: NodeContext: You're looking at your vampire prey, standing in the sun

OM_Astarion_COM_14.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_14.text: These days, I'm making the impossible look easy.

OM_Astarion_COM_65.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: To playerNodeContext: To player - he's asking permission to kill the Gur hunter, and he's very keen.

OM_Astarion_COM_157.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_157.context: NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun. This line leads to combat.

OM_Astarion_COM_168.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_168.text: No, we're going to leave in peace.

OM_Astarion_COM_156.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_156.text: Please do. But the vampire spawn is staying with me.

OM_Astarion_COM_166.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_166.text: Don't do this. No one needs to die.

OM_Astarion_COM_57.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_57.context: NodeContext: This line leads to combat.

OM_Astarion_COM_120.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_120.text: Well, I tried. Astarion? Kill the hunter.

OM_Astarion_COM_94.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_94.text: Thank you for the warning, we'll be careful.

OM_Astarion_COM_148.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_148.text: Wait - that's it? We're just walking away?

OM_Astarion_COM_126.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_126.text: Don't you think we should do something about the... vampire issue?

OM_Astarion_COM_45.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_45.text: I said we'll be careful. Now let's go.

OM_Astarion_COM_74.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_74.text: Fine. But if this comes back to bite us, it's on your head.

OM_Astarion_COM_159.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_159.text: Go in peace, my friends. I pray our paths cross again.

OM_Astarion_COM_167.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_167.context: NodeContext: Muttered while walking away. Response to 'I hope our paths cross again'

OM_Astarion_COM_78.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_78.context: NodeContext: Said with hunger - you've just been given permission to kill someone you hate

OM_Astarion_COM_70.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_70.context: NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun. This line leads to combat.

OM_Astarion_COM_163.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_163.text: Fine. This is Astarion, the vampire spawn you're hunting.

OM_Astarion_COM_6.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_6.context: NodeContext: Realises his vampire pray is standing in front of him, in the sun.

OM_Astarion_COM_16.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_16.text: You idiot. What have you done?

OM_Astarion_COM_35.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_35.text: I've delivered a monster to a monster hunter.

OM_Astarion_COM_137.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter knocks Astarion out while he's still focused on the player. The vampire collapses to the ground.

OM_Astarion_COM_26.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing over the unconcious body of Astarion.

OM_Astarion_COM_72.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_72.text: I thank you for your help. My people work to rid this world of evil - you are a friend to our cause.

OM_Astarion_COM_13.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_13.text: It's amazing you survived, travelling with a beast like that.

OM_Astarion_COM_146.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_146.text: I have a cage ready nearby - it will hold him when he wakes.
OM_Astarion_COM_146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunter pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over his shoulder.NodeContext: Leans down to pick up the unconcious Astarion, slinging him over your shoulder.

OM_Astarion_COM_79.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_79.text: Thank you for this. And for cleansing this swamp of the hag. You have done good here today. Safe travels.
OM_Astarion_COM_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter walks away, carrying an unconcious Astarion. He needs to disappear from view before exiting the dialog.NodeContext: While carrying an unconcious body. 'Thank you' line spoken while looking at the player, then you turn and start walking away before calling back the second line.

OM_Astarion_COM_77.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_77.text: I would have made a deal with the hag to find this. I'm very glad that I did not. Thank you and safe travels.
OM_Astarion_COM_77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gur Hunter walks away, carrying an unconcious Astarion. He needs to disappear from view before exiting the dialog.NodeContext: While carrying an unconcious body. 'Thank you' line spoken while looking at the player, then you turn and start walking away before calling back the second line.

OM_Astarion_COM_29.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_29.text: I'll return him to my tribe, as ordered. Whatever fate awaits him there, I'm sure it is deserved.

OM_Astarion_COM_112.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_112.text: Take the spawn, just leave his stuff with me.

OM_Astarion_COM_67.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_67.text: It's yours. This is the only prize I need.

OM_Astarion_COM_18.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_18.text: Relax, he's not taking you anywhere.

OM_Astarion_COM_9.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_9.text: Time for us to go! Good luck with your quest.

OM_Astarion_COM_136.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_136.text: Well, here he is. This is Astarion.

OM_Astarion_COM_97.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_97.text: His name is Astarion, but I fear he's gone to ground. I was hoping the hag of these lands could help me flush him out, but it seems she is no more.
OM_Astarion_COM_97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Astarion and the player exchange a look

OM_Astarion_COM_122.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_122.text: So what monster are you hunting?

OM_Astarion_COM_66.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_COM_66.text: Something terrifying, no doubt. Dragon? Cyclops? Kobold?
OM_Astarion_COM_66.context: NodeContext: Dragon and cyclops are huge and impressive, kobold is a runty little lizard creature.

OM_Astarion_COM_164.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_164.text: Nothing so dramatic. I'm hunting for a vampire spawn.

OM_Astarion_COM_160.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_160.text: If I were a cut-throat, I wouldn't admit it either.

OM_Astarion_COM_5.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_5.text: True. And I have no proof to offer but my word.

OM_Astarion_COM_111.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_111.text: If you wish it, our paths need not cross again. I'm hunting a vampire spawn, and it is a little too bright for you to be my prey.

OM_Astarion_COM_54.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_54.text: I knew you were a jackass, but a racist? I'm shocked.

OM_Astarion_COM_153.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_153.text: Your friend has just heard the rumours of my people. That we steal chickens, curse your crops, seduce your daughters...

OM_Astarion_COM_25.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_25.text: Be nice, Astarion. Gandrel here has been looking for you.

OM_Astarion_COM_59.speaker: Player
OM_Astarion_COM_59.text: Ignore the elf. He talks too much.

OM_Astarion_COM_149.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_149.text: You should listen to your companion. Next he'll warn you that my people can curse your cow to give only sour milk and will seduce your daughter to a life of roaming.

OM_Astarion_COM_125.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_COM_125.text: You've tracked me down again, my friend. Would that I had as much luck with the beast I'm hunting.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_25.speaker: Narrator
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_25.text: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_5.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_5.text: Forgive the aroma. Powdered iron-vine - an old hunters' trick. Most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_52.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_52.text: You're a monster hunter? I'm surprised - I thought all Gur were wandering cut-throats.
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_52.context: NodeContext: Doesn't think much of Gur.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_27.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_27.text: Not just cut-throats! We're thieves, con artists, vagrants - the list goes on.
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_27.context: NodeContext: Joking in response to your stereotype of his people

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_38.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_38.text: I wish I had half the power you settled folk think my people possess. Alas, I am a simple wanderer, on the hunt.
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_38.context: NodeContext: Good humoured, with a laugh

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_32.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_32.text: And what is your prey exactly? Dragon? Cyclops? Kobold?
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_32.context: NodeContext: Dragon and cyclops are huge and impressive, kobold is a runty little lizard creature.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_11.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_11.text: Nothing so dramatic. I'm hunting for a vampire spawn.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_43.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_43.context: NodeContext: is going to say 'a vampire spawn??' in shock, but catches himself.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_2.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_2.text: I'm on a mission from the head of my tribe. She sent me here to capture the beast.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_56.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_56.text: And return him to Baldur's Gate, no doubt?
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_56.context: NodeContext: Darkly. Astarion realises he'll have to kill this hunter.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_34.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_34.text: ...What do you know of this creature?

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_42.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_42.text: Oh, I know everything about him.
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_42.context: CinematicNodeContext: bares fangsNodeContext: bares fangs in response to 'what do you know of this creature?'

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_10.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_10.text: It can't be. It's not possible.
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_10.context: NodeContext: You see your prey in front of you - a vampire standing in the sunlight. After this line, it goes straight to combat.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_28.speaker: Narrator
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_28.text: *You catch a waft of something foul - metallic and sickly-sweet.*

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_20.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_20.text: Forgive the aroma. Powdered iron-vine - an old hunters' trick. Most monsters will think twice before making a meal of me.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_8.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_8.text: It'd make me think twice, certainly.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_50.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_50.text: I fear it is needed. I am hunting a wicked evil. A beast that prowls the night.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_29.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_29.text: A vile little creature: a vampire spawn named Astarion.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_57.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_57.text: Are you all right, my friend? You look a little pale.
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Surprise on Astarion's faceNodeContext: Noticed the look of shock on Astarion's face.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_30.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_30.text: And when you find him? Will you kill this Astarion?

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_24.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_24.text: As much as I'd like to, no.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_12.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_12.text: I'm on a mission from the head of my tribe. She sent me here to capture the beast.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_31.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_31.text: I am to return him to Baldur's Gate alive. Or as close to 'alive' as a vampire gets.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_0.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_0.text: I've just remembered I need to be somewhere. But good luck with your hunt.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_51.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_51.text: And good luck to you, my friend. Be safe.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_19.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_19.text: My people were recently attacked in the night - our camp set upon by a band of vampire spawn.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_36.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_36.text: In the chaos of battle, one of them stole away with our children. We have been searching for them ever since.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_62.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_62.text: We believe this Astarion knows exactly what happened that night, and where to find our little ones.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_61.speaker: Narrator
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_61.text: *You remember the night well. The shouts of battle, the screams of the children as you dragged them away...*

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_1.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_1.text: I wouldn't blame the vampire spawn - I hear they have to follow their master's orders.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_60.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_60.text: Monsters are monsters. And whatever his reasons, the monster still knows where our children are.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_55.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_55.context: NodeContext: Astarion - a vampire -is standing in front of you in broad daylight. After this line, you immediately go into combat.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_45.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_45.text: How do you plan to find him?

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_15.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_15.text: I am hoping the hag of these lands can help me. If I could afford her price.
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_15.context: NodeContext: He knows her price will be high - not just financially, it'll cost him something dear to him.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_41.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_41.text: I've been hunting at night, but not found any trace of my prey.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_58.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_58.text: He cannot hide forever, though. I will catch him and return him to Baldur's Gate.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_40.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_40.text: I had hoped the hag of these lands could help me, but it seems she is no more. For the best, perhaps.
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_40.context: NodeContext: The hag is dead. She could have been useful, but she was a monster. He has mixed feelings about her being killed.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_33.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_33.text: I'm feeling a little ill, actually. I should go.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_49.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_49.text: Of course. Be safe on your travels.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_48.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_48.text: You're in the right place - there's plenty of evil here.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_44.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_44.text: I seek only one evil: a vampire spawn named Astarion.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_21.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_21.text: Well, you stink. I'm sure that'll protect you.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_14.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_14.text: I hope so. Anything that discourages a bite. I'm hunting a vampire, you see.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_6.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_6.text: Why should I believe anything you say?

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_9.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_9.text: Believe or don't. It changes nothing about my mission. I'm hunting a vampire, you see.
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_9.context: NodeContext: Gandrel doesn't care either way.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_39.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_39.text: Well, not a true vampire. A spawn named Astarion.
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_39.context: NodeContext: A vampire spawn isn't a 'real' vampire after all.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_7.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_7.text: I've met people like you before. You're a Gur, aren't you?

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_35.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_35.text: Guilty. My people are wanderers - we travel across Faerûn, doing what good we can, where we can.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_47.speaker: Gandrel
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_47.text: Here, I will rid this land of a wicked evil. A beast that prowls the night.

OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_26.speaker: Astarion
OM_Astarion_AOM_OOM_26.text: Funny. I thought your people were all cut-throats, not monster hunters.
